<url>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/lib/tpl/ogf/images/favicon.ico</url>     </image>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/standards/standards?rev=1424901721&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-25T17:02:01-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>standards:standards</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/standards/standards?rev=1424901721&do=diff</link>         <description>OGF Documents and Standards  Looking for our published document series? Click on the Documents link to see the complete list of the published OGF formal documents and standards.  OGF is committed to the creation of well-thought-out standards, APIs and design patterns to maximize the productivity of users, suppliers, service providers and programmers in modern advanced distributed computing settings. As described in our</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/start?rev=1424882785&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-25T11:46:25-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>start</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/start?rev=1424882785&do=diff</link>         <description>Open Grid Forum  An Open Global Forum for Advanced Distributed Computing  OGF is an open global community committed to driving the rapid evolution and adoption of modern advanced applied distributed computing, including cloud, grid and associated storage, networking and workflow methods. OGF is focused on developing and promoting innovative scalable techniques, applications and infrastructures to improve productivity in the enterprise and within the international research, science and business c\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/ogf-44?rev=1424820408&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-24T18:26:48-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>events:ogf-44</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/ogf-44?rev=1424820408&do=diff</link>         <description>OGF 44 will be held May 21-22, 2015 co-located with the EGI Conference 2015 that will be held May 18-22, 2015 in Lisbon, Portugal. The OGF group meetings will run from Thursday through Friday and will all topics topics of general interest to the OGF community, including meetings of the cloud, grid, networking, security, applications and</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/sidebar?rev=1424819912&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-24T18:18:32-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>events:sidebar</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/sidebar?rev=1424819912&do=diff</link>         <description>Upcoming Events   OGF-43    - Event Home    - Schedule    - Call for Session Proposals    - GEC 22 Information    - Registration  OGF-44    - Event Home    - Schedule    - Call for Session Proposals    - EGI'2015 Information    - Registration   ----------  Past Events   OGF-42  OGF-41  OGF-40  OGF-39  OGF-38b  OGF-38a  OGF37  OGF36  OGF35  OGF34  OGF33  OGF32  OGF31  OGF30  OGF29  OGF28  OGF27  OGF26  OGF25  OGF24  OGF23  OGF22  OGF21  OGF20  OGF19  OGF18  GGF17  GGF16  GGF15  GGF14  GGF13  GGF1\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/ogf-43?rev=1424819721&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-24T18:15:21-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>events:ogf-43</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/ogf-43?rev=1424819721&do=diff</link>         <description>OGF 43 will be held March 25-27, 2015 co-located with the GENI Engineering Conference 22 (GEC22) and US Ignite Application Summit that will be held March 23-26, 2015 at the Hilton Crystal City Hotel at Washington Reagan National Airport in Crystal City, Virginia near Washington DC, USA. The OGF group meetings will run from Wednesday through Friday and will highlight mutual topics between the networking, security, applications and</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/about?rev=1424811739&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-24T16:02:19-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>about - [Who We Are] </title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/about?rev=1424811739&do=diff</link>         <description>Who We Are  The Open Grid Forum (OGF) is a community of users, developers, and vendors leading the global standardization effort for distributed computing (including clusters, grids and clouds). The OGF community consists of thousands of individuals in industry and research, representing over 400 organizations in more than 50 countries. Together we work to accelerate adoption of grid computing worldwide because we believe grids will lead to new discoveries, new opportunities, and better business\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/documents/documents?rev=1424732653&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-23T18:04:13-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>         <title>documents:documents</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/documents/documents?rev=1424732653&do=diff</link>         <description>OGF Published Documents  OGF documents are developed according to an open public process as described at this link.  GFD   Type   Area   Group   Publication  Title   Authors    EXP             Data                    DFDL-WG               2015-02-23   Data Format Description Language (DFDL) v1.0 Experience Document 3 - Bit Order and Encodings</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/?image=events%3Aegi_conference_2015_medium.png&ns=events&rev=1424472789&tab_details=history&mediado=diff&do=media">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-20T17:53:09-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>events:egi_conference_2015_medium.png - created</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/?image=events%3Aegi_conference_2015_medium.png&ns=events&rev=1424472789&tab_details=history&mediado=diff&do=media</link>         <description><img src="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/lib/exe/fetch.php/events/egi_conference_2015_medium.png?w=333&h=472&t=1424472789&amp;tok=767e16" alt="events:egi_conference_2015_medium.png" /></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/events?rev=1424463534&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-20T15:18:54-04:00</dc:date>         <dc:creator>alan.sill</dc:creator>         <title>events:events</title>         <link>https://www.ogf.org/ogf/doku.php/events/events?rev=1424463534&do=diff</link>         <description>Upcoming OGF Events  OGF\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds first event in 2015 will be OGF 43, to take place March 25-27, 2015 co-located with the GENI Engineering Conference to be held March 23-26, 2015 in Crystal City, Virginia (near Washington DC), USA. The OGF group meetings will run from Wednesday through Friday and will highlight mutual topics between the networking, security, applications and</description>     </item>     <item
